markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 15"
    pfs="Restricted"
>
[Book of Lost Days](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1640)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Unique" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=161" />
<trait label="Cursed" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=274" />
<trait label="Enchantment" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=61" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 160</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 2 hands

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This massive tome's yellowed pages curl at the edges, and the letters on its face and spine are too worn to be read. When you open the book, it always opens to a page that seems to perfectly answer the question you had in mind, but reading more than a few lines causes your head to swim alarmingly.

<document level="2" id="action-1245" />

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Book of Lost Days

text: <title level="1" right="Item 15" pfs="Restricted" > Book of Lost Days Source Dark Archive pg. 160 Usage held in 2 hands Bulk 1 --- This massive tome's yellowed pages curl at the edges, and the letters on its face and spine are too worn to be read. When you open the book, it always opens to a page that seems to perfectly answer the question you had in mind, but reading more than a few lines causes your head to swim alarmingly.
